title: One way to get rid of toxicity
body:
We all know it, we all hate it. So, why not deal with it harshly?

My idea is this:

When someone says a phrase like "kys" they get a debuff. Something like 30% slow for 5 min. Or 30% less dmg. If they do it again they get another debuff and so on. If they get to the point where stats are 99% gone then they get a ban when game is over. That way they know right away that they're being toxic and they either choose to not do it, or they choose to be banned.

replies.body: that and from my exp, most toxicity comes from a feeder. so someone feeders hardcore and another flames but the flamer gets punished yet again and the feeder does not.
Feeders might just be having a bad day. but phrases like "I'll feed" or such will incur the same penalties

I agree but there needs to be a point were they tank a rank ban or something. in this short season so far I've had multiple games with people have 10+ deaths and less than 8 kills and assists combined

so it isnÂ´t enough for the 4 other players on the team to have a flamer, but they should also be punished by haveing the system make him more and more useless as the game goes on, prompting that player to feed...
I would rather just ban them instead of lose games because we nerf their personal stats.
You're likely to lose anyway though. How many times have you won with a troll on your team? How many have you lost?

If such a thing was implemented, players that are aware of the system would just try to bypass it any way they could with clever spelling and spaces.

Instead of "kys"
It would be "k.y.s."

There would be no end to the variations.
And so the system would need constant updates. The current system does catch players, but its a lot slower.
And make trolling people so they get mad a viable strategy? No. Just... No.
There's such a thing as self control though. If someone can get tilted so easily then should they really play?
